name: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.agent
description: Seamlessly coordinates LLMs & tools per user input
subtitle: ={{ {	conversationalAgent: 'Conversational Agent', openAiFunctionsAgent: 'OpenAI Functions Agent', reactAgent: 'ReAct Agent', sqlAgent: 'SQL Agent' }[$parameter.agent] }}

options.name: Conversational Agent
options.description: Selects tools to accomplish its task and uses memory to recall previous conversations

options.name: OpenAI Functions Agent
options.description: Utilizes OpenAI's Function Calling feature to select the appropriate tool and arguments for execution

options.name: ReAct Agent
options.description: Strategically select tools to accomplish a given task

options.name: SQL Agent
options.description: Answers questions about data in an SQL database

options.name: humanMessage
options.description: The message that will provide the agent with a list of tools to use

options.name: systemMessage
options.default:
Assistant is a large language model trained by OpenAI.

Assistant is designed to be able to assist with a wide range of tasks, from answering simple questions to providing in-depth explanations and discussions on a wide range of topics. As a language model, Assistant is able to generate human-like text based on the input it receives, allowing it to engage in natural-sounding conversations and provide responses that are coherent and relevant to the topic at hand.

Assistant is constantly learning and improving, and its capabilities are constantly evolving. It is able to process and understand large amounts of text, and can use this knowledge to provide accurate and informative responses to a wide range of questions. Additionally, Assistant is able to generate its own text based on the input it receives, allowing it to engage in discussions and provide explanations and descriptions on a wide range of topics.

Overall, Assistant is a powerful system that can help with a wide range of tasks and provide valuable insights and information on a wide range of topics. Whether you need help with a specific question or just want to have a conversation about a particular topic, Assistant is here to assist.
options.description: The message that will be sent to the agent before the conversation starts

options.name: maxIterations
options.description: The maximum number of iterations the agent will run before stopping

options.name: systemMessage
options.default: You are a helpful AI assistant.
options.description: The message that will be sent to the agent before the conversation starts

options.name: maxIterations
options.description: The maximum number of iterations the agent will run before stopping

options.name: humanMessageTemplate
options.description: String to use directly as the human message template

options.name: prefix
options.default: Answer the following questions as best you can. You have access to the following tools:
options.description: String to put before the list of tools

options.name: suffixChat
options.default: Begin! Reminder to always use the exact characters `Final Answer` when responding.
options.description: String to put after the list of tools that will be used if chat model is used

options.name: suffix
options.description: String to put after the list of tools that will be used if regular model is used

properties.name: dataSource
properties.description: SQL database to connect to

options.name: MySQL
options.description: Connect to a MySQL database

options.name: Postgres
options.description: Connect to a Postgres database

options.name: SQLite
options.description: Use SQLite by connecting a database file as binary input

options.name: ignoredTables
options.description: Comma-separated list of tables to ignore from the database. If empty, no tables are ignored.

options.name: includedSampleRows
options.description: Number of sample rows to include in the prompt to the agent. It helps the agent to understand the schema of the database but it also increases the amount of tokens used.

options.name: includedTables
options.description: Comma-separated list of tables to include in the database. If empty, all tables are included.

options.name: prefixPrompt
options.default:
You are an agent designed to interact with an SQL database.
Given an input question, create a syntactically correct {dialect} query to run, then look at the results of the query and return the answer.
Unless the user specifies a specific number of examples they wish to obtain, always limit your query to at most {top_k} results using the LIMIT clause.
You can order the results by a relevant column to return the most interesting examples in the database.
Never query for all the columns from a specific table, only ask for a the few relevant columns given the question.
You have access to tools for interacting with the database.
Only use the below tools. Only use the information returned by the below tools to construct your final answer.
You MUST double check your query before executing it. If you get an error while executing a query, rewrite the query and try again.

DO NOT make any DML statements (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, DROP etc.) to the database.

If the question does not seem related to the database, just return "I don't know" as the answer.
options.description: Prefix prompt to use for the agent

options.name: suffixPrompt
options.description: Suffix prompt to use for the agent

options.name: topK
options.description: Number of top results agent should return

name: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.chainSummarization
description: Transforms text into a concise summary

properties.displayName: Specify the document to load in the document loader sub-node
properties.name: notice
type
properties.description: The type of summarization to run

options.name: Map Reduce (Recommended)
options.description: Individually summarizes each document using an LLM (Map step), then combines these summaries into a global summary (Reduce step), with an optional compression step to ensure fit

options.name: Refine
options.description: Iteratively updates its answer by looping over the documents and passing the current document along with the latest intermediate answer to an LLM, suitable for analyzing large document sets, albeit with more LLM calls

options.name: Stuff
options.description: Inserts all documents into a prompt, then passes it to an LLM for summarization, ideal for small document sets

options.name: combineMapPrompt
options.default:
Write a concise summary of the following:


"{text}"


CONCISE SUMMARY:

options.name: prompt
options.default:
Write a concise summary of the following:


"{text}"


CONCISE SUMMARY:

options.name: refinePrompt
options.default:
Your job is to produce a final summary
We have provided an existing summary up to a certain point: "{existing_answer}"
We have the opportunity to refine the existing summary
(only if needed) with some more context below.
------------
"{text}"
------------

Given the new context, refine the original summary
If the context isn't useful, return the original summary.

REFINED SUMMARY:

options.name: refineQuestionPrompt
options.default:
Write a concise summary of the following:


"{text}"


CONCISE SUMMARY:

properties.displayName: The options below to add prompts are only valid for chat models, they will be ignored for other models.
properties.name: notice

name: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.chainRetrievalQa
description: Retrieves answers to queries based on retrieved documents

name: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.code
description: LangChain Code Node
inputs: ={{ ((values) => { const connectorTypes = {"ai_chain":"Chain","ai_document":"Document","ai_embedding":"Embedding","ai_languageModel":"Language Model","ai_memory":"Memory","ai_outputParser":"Output Parser","ai_textSplitter":"Text Splitter","ai_tool":"Tool","ai_vectorStore":"Vector Store","main":"Main"}; return values.map(value => { return { type: value.type, required: value.required, maxConnections: value.maxConnections === -1 ? undefined : value.maxConnections, displayName: connectorTypes[value.type] !== 'Main' ? connectorTypes[value.type] : undefined } } ) })($parameter.inputs.input) }}
outputs: ={{ ((values) => { const connectorTypes = {"ai_chain":"Chain","ai_document":"Document","ai_embedding":"Embedding","ai_languageModel":"Language Model","ai_memory":"Memory","ai_outputParser":"Output Parser","ai_textSplitter":"Text Splitter","ai_tool":"Tool","ai_vectorStore":"Vector Store","main":"Main"}; return values.map(value => { return { type: value.type, displayName: connectorTypes[value.type] !== 'Main' ? connectorTypes[value.type] : undefined } } ) })($parameter.outputs.output) }}

values.name: code
values.hint: This code will only run and return data if a "Main" input & output got created.

values.name: code
values.default:
const { WikipediaQueryRun } = require('langchain/tools');
return new WikipediaQueryRun();
values.hint: This code will only run and return data if an output got created which is not "Main".

properties.displayName: You can import LangChain and use all available functionality. Debug by using console.log() statements and viewing their output in the browser console.
properties.name: notice
inputs
properties.description: The input to add

values.name: maxConnections
values.description: How many nodes of this type are allowed to be connected. Set it to -1 for unlimited.

values.name: required
values.description: Whether the input needs a connection

properties.name: outputs
properties.description: The output to add

name: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.lmChatAnthropic
description: Language Model Anthropic

properties.name: model
properties.description: The model which will generate the completion. Learn more.

properties.name: options
properties.description: Additional options to add

options.name: maxTokensToSample
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls randomness: Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive.

options.name: topK
options.description: Used to remove "long tail" low probability responses. Defaults to -1, which disables it.

options.name: topP
options.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling: 0.5 means half of all likelihood-weighted options are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

name: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.lmChatOpenAi
description: For advanced usage with an AI chain

properties.name: model
properties.description: The model which will generate the completion. Learn more.

properties.name: options
properties.description: Additional options to add

options.name: baseURL
options.description: Override the default base URL for the API

options.name: frequencyPenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim

options.name: maxTokens
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 32,768).

options.name: presencePenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls randomness: Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive.

options.name: timeout
options.description: Maximum amount of time a request is allowed to take in seconds

options.name: topP
options.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling: 0.5 means half of all likelihood-weighted options are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

properties.name: options
properties.description: Additional options to add

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls randomness: Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive.

options.name: topK
options.description: Used to remove "long tail" low probability responses. Defaults to -1, which disables it.

name: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.lmOpenHuggingFaceInference
description: Language Model HuggingFaceInference

properties.name: options
properties.description: Additional options to add

options.name: endpointUrl
options.description: Custom endpoint URL

options.name: frequencyPenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim

options.name: maxTokens
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 32,768).

options.name: presencePenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls randomness: Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive.

options.name: topK
options.description: Controls the top tokens to consider within the sample operation to create new text

options.name: topP
options.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling: 0.5 means half of all likelihood-weighted options are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

name: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.toolCode
description: Create a tool via code

properties.name: description
properties.placeholder: Call this tool to get a random color. The input should be a string with comma separted names of colors to exclude.

properties.name: jsCode
properties.hint: You can access the input the tool receives via the input property "query". The returned value should be a single string.
properties.description:
JavaScript code to execute.

Tip: You can use luxon vars like $today for dates and $jmespath for querying JSON structures. Learn more.

properties.name: pythonCode
properties.hint: You can access the input the tool receives via the input property "query". The returned value should be a single string.
properties.description:
Python code to execute.

Tip: You can use luxon vars like _today for dates and $_mespath for querying JSON structures. Learn more.

name: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.toolSerpApi
description: Search in Google using SerpAPI

options.name: gl
options.description: Defines the country to use for search. Head to Google countries page for a full list of supported countries.

options.name: device
options.description: Device to use to get the results

options.name: no_cache
options.description: Whether to force SerpApi to fetch the Google results even if a cached version is already present. Cache expires after 1h. Cached searches are free, and are not counted towards your searches per month.

options.name: google_domain
options.description: Defines the country to use for search. Head to Google countries page for a full list of supported countries.

options.name: hl
options.description: Defines the language to use. It's a two-letter language code. (e.g., `en` for English, `es` for Spanish, or `fr` for French). Head to Google languages page for a full list of supported languages.

properties.displayName: The embbded data are stored in the server memory, so they will be lost when the server is restarted. Additionally, if the amount of data is too large, it may cause the server to crash due to insufficient memory.
